Linux Packages
If a package for your distribution is listed above, install that and then try using it! Otherwise, get the source package instead.
Arch Linux
Use the zeroinstall-injector AUR package.
Debian / Knoppix / Mint / Ubuntu
Zero Install is part of the main Debian archive, so you can get it with: # apt-get install zeroinstall-injector
Ubuntu 12.04 LTS: you may find a newer version works better: the Raring .deb works fine.
You may also install your distribution's version by clicking here.
Use on headless servers: If used on headless servers, the Debian packages above pull in a lot of GUI dependencies (~100 MB) which aren't needed. To avoid this, there is a PPA with separate core and GUI packages, which can be used as follows (on Debian and Ubuntu): apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80/ \ --recv FA7EE6962EA1EE2BC2BCF43BFA1C88090D3A39C1 echo "deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/tal-it-innovation/ppa/ubuntu precise main" \ >> /etc/apt/sources.list apt-get update apt-get install 0install-core --no-install-recommends
Unfortunately, we cannot unload these packages to the main Debian archvie until after Debian 7 is released.
Fedora A package is in Fedora (thanks to Michel Alexandre Salim), so just do: # yum install zeroinstall-injector
Newer versions are also available from the build service.
Gentoo
zeroinstall-injector is in Portage (the version, 0.49, is very old though).
